benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Remove custom fields from payment

covered: Valid Deletion: multiple scenarios demonstrate removal of all or selected custom fields (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC06, TC07, TC15, TC20).
Header/Authorization handling: tests for required header and various header scenarios (TC03, TC11, TC12, TC17).
Error handling and input validation: invalid paymentId format (TC08), non-existent payment (TC09), invalid/non-existent customField IDs (TC10, TC13, TC16, TC18).
Edge cases and parameter handling: extra/unexpected query params (TC05), maximum/minimum IDs (TC06/07), large payloads (TC15), 1000 IDs (TC15).
Integration/dependent services: audit log service availability/unavailability (TC21, TC22) and backward compatibility (TC23).
Resilience and performance: service unavailable (TC14) and performance check (TC19).
Regression/scenario coverage: regression test (TC20) and integration with dependent services (TC21/22).
gaps: Concurrency: no tests cover race conditions when multiple clients delete concurrently.
Soft deletes: no test clarifies whether deletes are soft or hard deletes (audit trail expectation).
Authorization coverage: 403 Forbidden scenarios not explicitly tested (only 401 unauthorized).
Caching behavior: no tests for ETag/Cache-Control headers.
Rate limiting: no tests for throttling or rate limits.
Pagination for large result sets: not applicable to DELETE, but guideline coverage is missing; could be considered for consistency with GET tests.
recommendations: Add concurrency tests to ensure idempotency and race-condition resilience (e.g., two concurrent deletes on same payment).
Include a 403 Forbidden scenario to cover authorization beyond authentication.
Add tests asserting caching headers presence where applicable (ETag, Cache-Control).
Introduce rate-limiting tests to ensure proper handling under load.
Clarify and test soft-delete semantics if applicable (e.g., verify whether deletion is hard or soft).
Add an idempotence test: repeated DELETE calls should remain 204 with empty body.
Consider explicit pagination-themed tests only if the backend supports paginating the DELETE path; otherwise document as not applicable.
